intro: Cassia leiandra var. peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian cassia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight.
